column5: I've spent the last while posting my trip report history from the last 20+ yrs or so. If interested in seeing the places I've been here are the links to all over them. Enjoy and any questions feel free to pm me. Mike DeGrace Aston Lake 1988http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...n-lake-1988-1/ Aston Lake 1989http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...ton-lake-1989/ Chris Willis Lake 1990http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...lis-lake-1990/ Cypress River Lake 1991http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...ver-lake-1991/ Biggs Lake 1993http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...ggs-lake-1993/ McLeister Lake 1996http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...ter-lake-1994/ Katagi Lake 1997http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...agi-lake-1997/ McGowan Lake 1998http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...wan-lake-1998/ Ridley Lake 1999http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...ley-lake-1999/ Goat Lakehttp://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...oat-lake-2000/ Jungfrau Lake 2001http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...rau-lake-2001/ Whitefish Lake 2002http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...ish-lake-2002/ Elbow Lake 2003http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...bow-lake-2003/ Kellow Lake 2004http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...low-lake-2004/ Muskrat Lake 2005http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...rat-lake-2005/ Whittle Lake 2006http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...tle-lake-2006/ Felsia Lake 2007http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...sia-lake-2007/ Whittle Lake 2008http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...tle-lake-2008/ Percy Lake 2009http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...rcy-lake-2009/ Whitefish Lake 2010http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...ish-lake-2010/ Apisabigo Lake 2012http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...igo-lake-2012/ Medhurst Lake 2013http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...rst-lake-2013/ Little Missinaibi Lake 2014http://www.canadafishingguide.net/fo...abi-lake-2014/
Nice history of trip reports. Thanks for posting! I went to whittle lake once, never seen so many bears
Wow. Quite the list. Looks like a lot of good memories.

I think that's the toughest question I've ever been asked as all of them were great for one reason or another. I'm going to say best trip as it was the start of it all was the first one. As for best lake, Muskrat Lake had to be my favorite as it had a ton of water fish and we seemed to catch them just about everywhere we tried and it also both size and numbers to keep us entertained. I will definity fish this one again someday. Now that being said I've enjoyed every trip and every lake I've fished for one reason or another. I've only ever crossed paths with 2 outfitters I didn't like and they are both out of business now so maybe that just wasn't me not liking them and one bad experience with a pilot in all that time.
